** Rivian Automotive Inc RIVN.O shares up 12.5% at $146.23 on Mon, and the Amazon.com AMZN.O-backed EV maker now up 90% from last week's $78 IPO price

** At stock's session high of $150.39, Rivian's market value surpassed $130 bln, based on ~868.3 mln total shares outstanding from co's filing on Fri

** Despite just having started selling vehicles and having little revenue to report RIVN'S market cap has surpassed GM's GM.N ~$92 bln current market value and Ford's F.N ~$79 bln, per Refinitiv data. Ford owns roughly 12% stake in Rivian

** EV maker Lucid Group LCID.O, slated to report qtrly results after the bell on Mon, has market cap approaching $72 bln (Full Story)

** Meanwhile, Tesla's TSLA.O market value falls below $1 trln for second time in four sessions in wake of CEO Elon Musk's recent stock sales of nearly ~$7 bln and his Twitter spat with U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders (Full Story)


(Lance Tupper is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own)
